relation: Specify the client ID for which you want to attempt release. Obtain the client ID by running the crsctl get clientid command.
The port to which CRSCTL sends the release packets. If you do not specify a port, then CRSCTL uses the default value 67.
textBeforeTable: Table E-26 crsctl release dhcp Command Parameters Parameters crsctl release dhcp -clientid clientid [-port port]  Syntax Starting with Oracle Database 11g release 2 (11.2.0.2), use the crsctl release dhcp command to send a DHCP lease release request to a specific client ID and send release packets on the network to a specific port. crsctl release dhcp   CRS-10021: timeout for each name lookup is: 1 CRS-10020: number of retry attempts for name lookup is: 2 192.168.202.15 192.168.249.52 192.168.249.41 CRS-10022: There are 3 name servers. They are: foocorp.com foo.com us.foo.com CRS-10019: There are 3 domains in search order. They are: CRS-10018: the following configuration was found on the system:  If you choose the -servers option, then the command returns output similar to the following: stmjk07-vip.stmjk0462.foo.com CRS-10024: DNS server returned 192.168.29.250 for name  The crsctl query dns command returns output similar to the following for a DNS server named stmjk07-vip.stmjk0462.foo.com: Example  Verbose output. -v     Specify the timeout length in seconds.  -timeout timeout_in_seconds     Specify the number of retry attempts.  -attempts number_of_attempts
textAfterTable: Example The crsctl release dhcp command returns output similar to the following:  $ crsctl release dhcp -clientid stmjk0462clr-stmjk01-vip CRS-10012: released DHCP server lease for client ID stmjk0462clr-stmjk01-vip on port 67 crsctl relocate resource Use the crsctl relocate resource command to relocate resources to another server in the cluster. Syntax  crsctl relocate resource {resource_name | resource_name | -all -s source_server | -w "filter"} [-n destination_server] [-k cid] [-env "env1=val1,env2=val2,..."] [-i] [-f] Parameters Table E-27 crsctl relocate resource Command Parameters Parameter Description  resource_name The name of a resource you want to relocate.  resource_name | -all -s source_server Specify one particular or all resources located on a particular server from which you want to relocate those resources.  -w "filter" Specify a resource filter that Oracle Clusterware uses to limit the number of resources relocated. The filter must be enclosed
